Fields.DialogueText: We're under siege! Duilio, think you can go another round or two?
Don't underestimate me, Capitano! I have the endurance of a marathon runner! With me!
@BATTLE
Another one for the history books.
It would be a great honor to be spoken about in years to come by the next generation. Our battles, the stuff of legend...

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know you had aspirations of rising to such a prestigious rank.

Fields.DialogueText: A dream is a soldier's pay, Capitano, only it can't be traded.

Fields.MenuText: Italian culture is full of those, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: Italy has the vitality of youth, but it must be tempered with Rome's experience.

Fields.MenuText: I have no doubt the Morganas will also fall into the same category.

Fields.DialogueText: While that is true, I cannot think of a more painful eternity. To spend one's afterlife forced to watch on in horror as generation after generation scorns you. How hellish...
Regardless, good work out there today. That'll be all.
Capitano? Are you not forgetting something?
I don't think so.
Something very important.
Daily report?
No.
Radar check!
Try again.
I can't think of anything else that we need to do after winning a battle. What do we normally do when we achieve victory in...
Now that you mention it, I suppose I am hungry...
But I've got to earn it first. And that starts with protecting those soldiers of ours that aren't battleships.
Capitano, am I to assume from your blathering that you're not helping me eat the victory feast?
Honestly, Duilio... From the constant parties to the awards ceremony... I'm starting to think of you as nothing more than a common rebel.
It may look that way to an outsider, but I think you couldn't be more wrong. There’s as much morale in putting your house in order as there is in partying in it!

Fields.MenuText: I suppose we have to have something to look forward to without an end to the war in sight.

Fields.DialogueText: With each morning that breaks, I hope to come across a tabloid announcing the Morgana surrender. Yet, as each evening falls I resign myself to a lifetime of warfare.

Fields.MenuText: I would have hoped that the safety of future generations was motivation enough.

Fields.DialogueText: War is very blinding. It's easy for us to lose sight of the big picture after spending months focusing on individual battles. All the more reason to keep it from taking a toll.

Fields.MenuText: You do tend to be popular with the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Come now, Capitano. Just because we're at war does not mean the world has to be all bloodshed and mass slaughter pertaining to countless innocent lives. We can still have fun in the interim!
Very well. What kind of party will we be having this time?
We will dock soon, will we not?
I believe so. Perhaps in a few days.
Wonderful! In which case, I suggest we throw a ball!
A ball? Your brain must be suffering from Morgana rot.
I'm in perfect health, thank you very much!
The lovelorn on the dance floor may try their luck in port!
I see. Well, the crew have been working awfully hard lately. Those who aren't married worry every day that they may never feel the touch of another human ever again.
Does that mean...?
Have it your way. You always do. You know how to steer me better than you do this ship!
And what will the singletons do?
Wonderful!
In other news, we've received confirmation of our next mission.
I'm all ears.
We'll be covering a convoy to repair and resupply an installment that's recently fought off a Morgana attack. We should avoid combat wherever possible to keep the lines from fraying.
Avoid combat? In war? I'm sure those aren't your words, Capitano.
Well, yes, these are orders from above.
I figured as much. It seems we are still not trusted enough to take on a fleet of Morganas even though we have done so in the past.
War is all about making sacrifices.
Still... I can't help but feel we would succeed far sooner if left to our own devices.
That's all for now, anyway.
Still, I am glad to hear the news. A ball is such a special event and unlike any party we've thrown before.
What better occasion than a glorious defense? Let's hold off for now until the mission is complete!
I'm looking forward to it.
*ALARM*
I don't think the Morganas will be willing to wait that long. Let's deal with them quickly.
@BATTLE
Capitano! Capitano! Quickly, I need you!
What is it this...
Does this look like a crane to you?
Napkin folding? For the dance, I presume. I thought it was a giraffe...
I'm hopeless at this after all... I don't have the sleight of hand required for such an intricate task.

Fields.MenuText: I would have thought someone with your level of care and consideration would be adept at this.

Fields.DialogueText: I've slain whole flotillas with superior tactics and, failing that, brute strength.
A small piece of paper couldn't hope to withstand my level of force!

Fields.MenuText: So, you've settled on a theme then?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing more elaborate than a standard gala. Strictly ballroom dancing, no horseplay, and DEFINITELY no alcohol.
You've already decided everything...
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: Did you never try this as a child?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! What childhood would be complete without it?
Morganas! Duilio, think you can rustle me up some paper shells?
These Morganas are rough brutes, Capitano! I would not waste such valuable paper as this on them. Only cold hard steel!
@BATTLE
I can think of several.
... Perhaps I asked the wrong question.
How about now?
You know what... This one actually does look a bit like a crane.
It was supposed to be a rose! AH!
*THUMP*
Come now, Duilio, it isn't like you to fly into distress like this. I've never seen you so much as flustered.
Perhaps this war is starting to get to me...
Let me help you. Here, take my hand.
Capi--?
See? Fold it like this and then crease here.
Hm.
Voila! A... satisfactory...? Crane!
It's beautiful...

Fields.MenuText: It's not perfect, but--

Fields.DialogueText: No, Capitano! I could not muster something half as lovely as this.

Fields.MenuText: Duilio? Are you feeling all right? You look a little red.

Fields.DialogueText: *Ahem* I'm just dazzled by how good you are with your hands, Capitano. I MEAN-- Forget it...

Fields.MenuText: I remember my mother would often line the dining room table with something similar.

Fields.DialogueText: It must be nice to pick up skills from a parent. As one of the older Belles... well, I have history and companions to mentor me.
I'll show you how to do it again sometime and we can practice. I'm a fairly decent teacher when it comes time to educate.
I didn't realize you were so popular, Capitano. I thought I was the only one you would share such an intimate experience with...
What was that?
Nothing. Nothing at all. I'm just praising your ability to care for each member of the crew on an equal level. Playing favorites is clearly not your style of command.
Why do I feel like I've said something wrong?
*ALARM*
I couldn't possibly comment. Although, if that alarm is anything to go by, I would urge you to think the next time you speak!
To battle?
If you insist.
@BATTLE
First priority: picking up the essentials needed for the dance!
Do you have some kind of list that we can--
Right here, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: How long is that thing?!

Fields.DialogueText: I wanted to be as thorough as possible.

Fields.MenuText: What do we need?

Fields.DialogueText: Like I said, the essentials. Candles, confetti, drinks, food, outfits, et cetera. You did remember to bring your wallet, right?

Fields.MenuText: Will this be expensive?

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn't have thought so. I'll keep you posted!
We'll be docked here for some time, it looks like. While we wait for the convoy to pass by our perimeter, we should make haste to pick up any necessary supplies for battle as well.
Ha! According to you, we'll be having a picnic with the Morganas before we fire off any explosive shells...
In any case, there should be ample time for you to pick up your supplies and the crew to make their courtships.
If all goes well, we'll circle back round to Genoa after the mission and you can throw your party then.
*ALARM*
That must be the convoy! It seems they're already under attack!
Let's grant them safe passage into the port!
@BATTLE
Ah, Genoa! What a lovely place this is.
I too enjoy the scenery here, Capitano. Although, my feelings toward this place are still a little uneasy.
Why so?
I spent a long time in Genoa under reconstruction. While I heal much faster than humans do, I can see how being put out of action for any kind of extended period would weigh on the heart of a sailor.
Try not to live in the past. All that matters is that we're both healthy and raring to go! What's on the agenda?
Come now, Duilio. You're shooting the messenger here.
Apologies, Capitano. That a group of rotund gentlemen think they can read the tides of war from behind a desk in the comfort of the home front...
Well, it is irksome and I will leave it there. Idle complaints cannot be swung in battle.
As always, Duilio, your combat skills continue to impress.
Speaking of which, Capitano. should worse come to worst and we find ourselves forced into a combat scenario, an upgrade would come in handy.
You haven't been doing too badly out there, you know.
I would just feel more comfortable knowing I had the equipment necessary to attack and defend at the same time.

Fields.MenuText: Get your wish list to me in writing. I'll think about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Much appreciated, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: I think, in our current state, we'll be able to take on any foe.

Fields.DialogueText: An informed assessment, though it does not fill a scabbard.
We'll be here forever if we visit all of these stores together. How about we split up to cover more ground? I'll pick up some rations while you focus on party supplies.
I see. That clerk in the food market was very attractive, wasn't she?
We'll meet back here at thirteen hundred?
Hmph!
What's gotten into her?
@BATTLE
Well, I should circle back to the ship first. Who knows when we might suffer another attack?

Fields.MenuText: If you're fishing for compliments about how well you use your current equipment, I'm happy to oblige.

Fields.DialogueText: Flattery won't distract me, Capitano. Nice try.
The crew can't believe their luck...
I believe most of the singletons managed to mingle with the locals. Everyone was so grateful that we stopped the Morganas from docking that it made socializing with them even easier!

Fields.MenuText: Will you be attending the dance, Duilio?

Fields.DialogueText: As a chaperone, of course!

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised they all blended in so easily.

Fields.DialogueText: In a war against an otherworldly threat, one's country of origin is more than irrelevant. We're all fighting on the same side, one way or another.

Fields.MenuText: This is shaping up to be a rather large gathering. I wonder if we'll be able to stay afloat with so many on board.

Fields.DialogueText: Leave it to me, Capitano! I pitch no battle I haven't the strength to fight!
We'll be heading back out to sea soon, so make sure you've got everything you need before we go.
Capitano, look! What an elegant corsage... It reminds me of the flowers back home...
Duilio, did you hear me?
Hm? Apologies, Capitano. I'm ready to return when you are.
You go on ahead. I need to grab someone to sweep for any of our folks looking to settle down.
Aye-aye, Capitano! See that you don't settle yourself.
Wouldn't dream of it.
Never?
@BATTLE
Heh. Hands where you can see them, eh?
Like any other shift on watch.
... Not with Morganas to knock out. Now, of all times?
Delegate away, Capitano. We have crew enough to rise to the occasion!
Smooth sailing so far. I'm surprised the convoy sustained such damage in these untroubled waters.
Overconfidence will be your downfall, Duilio. You can't expect everything to go off without a hitch by doing nothing. Sometimes you need to take what you want before someone else does.
Take what I want? Capitano... Are you talking about...?

Fields.MenuText: Are you partial to escort missions like this?

Fields.DialogueText: It's nice being able to stretch the tactical side of the brain now and again. Half a battle is avoiding it.

Fields.MenuText: It is rather peaceful, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: The calm before the storm!

Fields.MenuText: If only all our missions were this lax.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't get complacent, Capitano. We still have a job to do.
Duilio, there! In the distance. Is that...?
That's our mark. They managed to catch up to us so quickly! You were right, Capitano, I underestimated our opponents!
That'll do. Let's continue our retreat while providing cover fire.
@BATTLE
Taking victory in battle, of course.
Right...
If you have time to wonder, we have time to fight!
Are you ready? It hasn't been so long since the last fight.
So much for "avoid combat wherever possible," huh?
Sorry, Capitano, I couldn't resist!
Nothing for it! Full steam ahead!
@BATTLE
That looks to be the last of them...
A roaring success! We must throw a party to celebrate!

Fields.MenuText: Duilio... We're already in the midst of planning a party.

Fields.DialogueText: So we are. Apologies, Capitano. I got caught up in the moment.

Fields.MenuText: Where do you get all that energy from?

Fields.DialogueText: There's no intoxicant quite like besting a rival in combat!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe I could have a lie down first...

Fields.DialogueText: No rest for the righteous, Capitano! We must push on!
Let's plot a course for our next destination.
Aye-ay-- Ah!
Duilio! What's the matter?
I believe I'm still a little sore from the maintenance performed on me during our previous ambush.
We took emergency procedures to get back on the sea as soon as possible. You told me you felt fine after that.
I didn't want to worry you. We have a schedule to keep. I can't spend three days being repaired.
Let's take a trip below decks. See if we can patch you up.
Feel free to go ahead. I can teleport to wherever you need me.
Now, hold on. We still need to talk, and you're not getting out of this conversation that easily.
Capitano? What are you--! Capitano! Unhand me!
You're not that heavy. I can carry you down to the engine room!
Put me down this instant!
The more Morganas that appear, the more I'm starting to realize that combat will prove to be vital in defending this convoy.
Those stuffed shirts have never been in an altercation in their lives. Regia Marina are happy to preach non belligeranza lest someone throw a fist in their vicinity.
What a quick fix those repairmen did. None of this will hold long term. I'm surprised we're even still afloat!
I didn't know you were such an engineer, Capitano. If you think you can fix it, by all means, please do.

Fields.MenuText: I'll need some water. I'll get dehydrated working this long inside of you.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you court all your harlots with such vulgar terminology, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: I've fixed up many a ship in my time. Don't worry.

Fields.DialogueText: Is that so? I didn't realize you had been around the block so much. Hmph!

Fields.MenuText: I'll get you up and running again in no time. I'm practiced in this regard.

Fields.DialogueText: Just how well practiced are you talking about, Capitano? I do not want your sullied hands rifling about my engine room...
*ALARM*
Morganas! Think you can handle them in your current state?
Please! If I made it this far on a lame leg, a Morgana or two is child's play!
Let's give them hell!
@BATTLE
What in the world are you-- ah. I get it.
Wait, you're the one who brought it--
Really, Capitano, this is highly unnecessary…
Come now. How many parties have you organized for my crew while I spent the night locked away in here? It's the least I can do.
Still… I just can't relax lying in your bed having you dote on me.
We're a little over halfway to our destination and the convoy is holding up nicely. I informed the men of what needs to be corrected below deck. Any further complications and heads will roll.
But, Capitano… All this trouble… Just for me…?

Fields.MenuText: You are the life and soul of this ship!

Fields.DialogueText: Literally.

Fields.MenuText: I like pampering people.

Fields.DialogueText: Breakfast in bed is a hobby of yours, is it?

Fields.MenuText: Even the strongest Belles need help sometimes.

Fields.DialogueText: I take that compliment in the spirit in which it was offered.
*ALARM*
You stay right here. The crew and I will take care of this fight.
I'm keeping a thumb on the scale, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Glad to have it.
I'm starting to get cabin fever being locked up in your room, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: The injuries you took would put a normal person out of commission for weeks.

Fields.DialogueText: If not kill them. For a woman of action such as myself, leaving the battlefield certainly feels like that.

Fields.MenuText: Have you ever sustained injuries like this before?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm fairly careful whenever I set foot into battle. Any wound I suffer is a defeat in my eyes.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know Belles had such regenerative abilities.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm resilient, but I'm not magic. Fixing up a leaking pipe will make me feel ten times better.
You should be good to go again soon. I'll miss taking care of YOU for a change.
If you really wanted to do something for me, Capitano, would you consider adding to my arsenal? A new weapon would scrub up nice next to my metaphorical fresh coat of paint.
So every time you sustain a scratch, I'm supposed to reward you with a pricey gift?
Worth a suggestion.
*ALARM*
I'm feeling much better now, Capitano. What say I join you on the battlefield?
If you're sure you're up to it. I'd love to have you beside me again.
Love...?
*Ahem* I mean, you are pivotal to our victory.
Of course! Let's move out!
@BATTLE
How are you feeling now, Duilio?
Never felt better! I feel as though I've just awakened again! Nay, as if I was just launched!

Fields.MenuText: Your early years must have been a heady time indeed.

Fields.DialogueText: Things picked up a bit after the Great War. The Black Sea in the Russian intervention... Corfu... I have been underused, but there is nothing like the hope of a new launch.

Fields.MenuText: Will you continue to fight after the war is over?

Fields.DialogueText: War will never truly end. As long as there are villains who would threaten my loved ones, I cannot sit by and idly watch.

Fields.MenuText: Do you feel as though you have grown since that day?

Fields.DialogueText: Immensely. You may be surprised to discover, Capitano, that I was a little tightly wound back then.
*ALARM*
Let's put your money where your mouth is.
Don't think I've forgotten my duty just because I've been laid up recently! I'll "destroy countless Morganas" you under the table!
Ha! That's the Duilio I know and--
Capitano? Are you going to finish that sentence?
*Ahem* The Morganas will not wait for us! Let's hurry!
@BATTLE
We've held up pretty well so far. Are you happy with the way things have panned out?
I'm always happy to see a mission go off without a hitch. The only better feeling is unhitching it myself.
It looks like you'll have a chance to stretch your muscles earlier than you thought! Morganas inbound!
Do you think we can take them?

Fields.MenuText: Even if we can, we have strict orders to fight a retreat.

Fields.DialogueText: How unfortunate...
Capitano! Your orders?!
Timely retreat! Protect the convoy at all costs!

Fields.MenuText: I think so.

Fields.DialogueText: I think so too. It's a shame we're somewhat shackled at the moment.

Fields.MenuText: What do you think?

Fields.DialogueText: You already know my stance, Capitano, but that look on your face tells me the decision has already been made. And not by yourself...
And for me, Capitano?
Please provide covering fire. I know it must be hard, but this is how the world works.
If the world works in a way that displeases you, you should fight to change it. At least, in my own humble opinion.
@BATTLE
We managed to fight them off for now, but they'll be back. We only took out one or two vessels with our cover fire.
This is exactly where my problem lies, Capitano. Were we to face our enemy head-on, we could cripple them enough to at least force a retreat.
The way this is going, we will sustain lasting damage with each retreat until we are eventually sunk!
A stitch in time has been known to save nine...

Fields.MenuText: Am I doing the right thing?

Fields.DialogueText: I would follow your orders to a watery grave, Capitano. Whether we prevail or fall, to doubt oneself is to already admit defeat.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think I relish abiding such orders?

Fields.DialogueText: Your expression says it all. I would have hoped the capitano I stand beside would know when the rules need to be broken.

Fields.MenuText: Do you really believe in us that much?

Fields.DialogueText: I believe that together, there is nothing that can stand in our way.
The fleet is catching up to us...
How much longer do you think we can run before fatigue catches up to us?
I need time to think! Let's continue our escape while taking down as many ships as we can in the process.
As you wish, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Without anyone watching over us, we could do anything we want!
Is your list that long? Of things you'd like to do under no supervision?
Aside from fighting without restraint? I'd have to think about it. How about you?

Fields.MenuText: It would be nice to get some paperwork done without being harassed about its deadline by my superiors.

Fields.DialogueText: Dream a little bigger, please, Capitano...
Wherever I am, whoever is around me, and whatever is breathing down the back of my neck, as long as you are by my side, I am content.
Capitano... We should check to see if any Morganas are in the area...
Oh, right! Please ignore my musings.
I feel the same way...
Shall we go?
With pleasure!

Fields.MenuText: We could finally have some alone time.

Fields.DialogueText: To do what, exactly?!

Fields.MenuText: I can walk around my office in my underwear.

Fields.DialogueText: There is no monitoring that anyway, Capitano. Still, I would hope you would not let loose quite so much.
The more you talk of a world without constant monitoring, the weaker my knees become.
I would be happy to whisper such sweet nothings to you all day long, Capitano.
@BATTLE
*KABOOM*
Capitano! Genoa is within our sight, but we won't make it at this rate!
Damn it all! To trip at the final hurdle like this is a disgrace!
If we took the offensive, I could steer several vessels away from the convoy! That would allow the rest of our group to focus their attention on cover fire!

Fields.MenuText: We can't!

Fields.DialogueText: Do you plan to use your medal of loyalty to decorate your gravestone?!
We need you to make the call!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we could...

Fields.DialogueText: I need your full permission before I can act, Capitano!
To hell with it all! Sound that alarm one more time for me!
*ALARM*
Let's show these Morganas that we will not take their beating lying down!
Aye-aye, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Here we are, safe and sound!
And the convoy looks to be in good health as well. I'm relieved.
I hope this instills some more confidence in you, Capitano!
I should be thanking you, Duilio. Were it not for your foot being placed firmly up my backside, I may never have realized that directives are not gospel.
Perhaps we could petition your superiors, using this mission as evidence. They may be inclined to give you a little more freedom.
Give US...
Right. Us.
Regardless, we expended a lot of resources during our escape. It would be wise to restock while we're docked.
Right you are.
Perhaps we could bolster our ranks while we're at it. I'm sure the young men of the town have become enthralled by our crew's tales of the sea.
I'll round up the crew while you deal with any unwanted visitors blocking our exit.
Aye-aye, Capitano!
@BATTLE
I'll get the word out - though our recent break has proven that you are all the support I need.
That's true as well!
Capitano! A moment.
Is there a problem?
We won't be heading out for a few more days, right?
While we restock and await further orders, yes.
I've nearly finished planning my dance, so I was hoping we could throw the party sometime soon.

Fields.MenuText: I see no problem with that.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to hear it!

Fields.MenuText: You've still been working on this in the interim between battles?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! It never left my mind!

Fields.MenuText: It would be a nice treat for the crew after having to follow my selfish orders.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure they're just happy to see you finally acting of your own will.
*ALARM*
Capitano! Morganas! Shall we retreat?
No need to tease me, Duilio. Have at it!
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me, Capitano?
Duilio, please have a seat.
Is something the matter?

Fields.MenuText: Will you be attending the dance?

Fields.DialogueText: I believe I said I would do so as a chaperone, yes.

Fields.MenuText: Do you like dancing?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm partial to a waltz every now and again.

Fields.MenuText: Do you feel any disappointment that you plan these parties but never attend them?

Fields.DialogueText: My joy comes from seeing the crew smiling.
What I mean to ask is... Would you like to attend the ball with me?
Excellent idea, Capitano! With two sets of eyes prowling the dancefloor, we can eradicate any heavy petting!
Not as a chaperone... As my date.
Your date? As in, an outing between would-be lovers?
I can't hold back these feelings anymore, Duilio. They've been steadily growing and I feel the need to express them.
I would be lying if I said I hadn't noticed. Or... if I said I hadn't been feeling the same way.
So, is that a yes?
I would love to, Capitano.
*ALARM*
A duel with the Morganas is not as romantic as I would have liked it to be.
But I'll certainly never forget it!
@BATTLE
Capitano... I'm ready to go when you are.
Let me just change out of these my uniform and we can...
Does it look strange? I wasn't sure if red was my color.

Fields.MenuText: Wow...
You look amazing...
It definitely is...

Fields.DialogueText: Please don't stare so much, Capitano. Your eyes should always remain fixated on the horizon, warding off potential threats.
Give me five minutes.
I'm looking forward to seeing you in formal clothing as well.
Oh, that reminds me... This is for you.
The corsage I was admiring... But--! When--! How--!
I snuck back after you returned to the ship.
You've been planning this since back then...
What can I say?
*ALARM*
I'll take care of the Morganas, Duilio. We wouldn't want you to ruin that dress.
I'm sure it'll be fine. I would not want to keep a piece of clothing that could not keep up with my day-to-day!
@BATTLE
This is nice...
Without the tables and chairs, the mess hall makes for a somewhat decent dance floor.
You are a surprisingly competent dancer, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: There's a lot you still don't know about me.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm looking forward to finding out.

Fields.MenuText: You think so?

Fields.DialogueText: Luckily, my feet are hardened from years of battle!

Fields.MenuText: I wish this moment would last forever.

Fields.DialogueText: How sweet...
*ALARM*
What unfortunate timing!
I wouldn't say so. Crew! Show your partners why you deserve to be with them! With me!
@BATTLE
This party is getting a little crowded, don't you think?
That's the mark of a successful party!

Fields.MenuText: I wanted to spend some time just the two of us.

Fields.DialogueText: I would like that as well, but what can we do?

Fields.MenuText: I can't say what I need to say in earshot of the entire crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano... Should I be worried or excited?

Fields.MenuText: Did we really have to invite so many people?

Fields.DialogueText: Look how happy everyone is! I'm relieved everyone is having a nice time.
Return with me to my quarters for a spell. I have something I want to tell you.
You want us to leave?
Just for a moment.
Well, if you insist...
*ALARM*
We'll use the cover of the Morganas to sneak away.
Okay.
@BATTLE
Are you sure it's okay to leave the party unattended?
I've given strict instructions to everyone and anyone caught acting up will be severely punished.
Why did you want to sneak away?
What would you say to a private dance?
I could hardly refuse such an invitation.
There's something I want to tell you, Duilio.
You can tell me anything, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: I think I've fallen for you.
I want you by my side, now and forever.
I need you in my life as more than just a crewmate.

Fields.DialogueText: How overt...! I... I feel the same way, but please don't make me say it too much...
It would indeed be nice not to have to worry about my flank.
I think we've long succeeded that time in our lives, Capitano.
I don't know yet exactly what I want from this... but what I do know is that I need you in my life.
Where's the fire, Capitano? This dance only just started. We don't need to skip to the end just yet.
*ALARM*
Perhaps the alarm could be "our song."
How romantic...
@BATTLE
We're under attack!
Duilio and I will handle this with a full frontal assault! Isn't that right?
I wouldn't have it any other way!
@BATTLE
What an adventure these past few weeks have been. What was your favorite moment?

Fields.MenuText: Our private dance.
Our final battle before docking.
The party.

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing quite like clearing a camp, is there? We would know.
That shall be the Regia Marina's favorite moment as well, mark my words.
Perhaps we should throw another ball to celebrate such a successful party!
Well, Command likes our results. I don't anticipate that'll be the last strategy we respectfully improvise on.
So long as we are together, there is nothing we can't face.
Then let's set sail into the sunset!
Aye-aye, Capitano!
Morale's stellar lately. You don't want to channel that into a victory?
The best kind of vicious cycle, and we set it in motion.
